title: First Annual Red Wing Park Shamrock Criterium
Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series
SpeedWorks Skills Clinic
description: SpeedWorks Coaching Skills Clinic - SpeedWorks will be hosting a road and general skills clinic.  This will be aimed at the beginning racer, recreational road rider, and anyone who wants to work on the skills that will make them a safer, more confident rider.  Skills Clinic will be run by SpeedWorks head coach, Mark Orton, a certified USA Cycling Level 2 Coach and Certified Skills Instructor.  Mark is also a professional mountain bike racer on the Mafia Racing Team.  Cat 5 men and Cat 4 women can use this skills clinic for upgrade points.
course: Skills Clinic will last for 4 hours, give or take a little to get through the skills planned.  8am til 12noon.  This information will be updated as the details are worked out, keep checking www.speedworkscoaching.com for more information!
registration:
Registration is online at USA Cycling (www.usacycing.org).
Or contact Mark at mark.orton@speedworkscoaching.com

title: 2012 Roanoke Twilight Criterium
description: A downtown criterium held on the evening and night of April 16th. The Roanoke Twilight Criterium is a partner event of the now legendary Blue Ridge Marathon and has one of the biggest purses in the state. Race at night under the lights and enjoy what downtown Roanoke has to offer.
course: An \"L\" shaped .7 mile course that is familiar to many veteran races. The course has been in use for two decades in such races as Festival Cup. It\'s a fast course with just a small rise. The course will be well-lit.
directions: Start/Finish is on the 100 block of Church Avenue, downtown Roanoke, VA. See www.roanoketwilight.com for directions to numerous free parking areas.

title: 2012 Starlight Criterium
description: A fun 4 corner criterium on teh grounds of the Roanoke Civic Center. The race is the day after the Roanoke Twilight Criterium and is a Virginia BAR event.
course: 4 corners around the Roanoke Civic Center building. One small dip/rise in the back but other than that flat.
directions: The Civic Center is located at 715 Williamson Road just next to downtown Roanoke. There will be ample parking.

title: Cirque Cyclosportive
description: A cyclosportive (or “sportive”) is a European-style cycling event sometimes known by its Italian name, gran fondo. A sportive includes a mass-start, three route length options, refreshment/aid/checkpoint stations, on-course technical support and SAG wagons, and timed segment(s) of the course.
course:
The Cirque Cyclosportive will make use of the most lightly traveled roads in Loudoun County. Many of these are unpaved and surfaced with gravel. Approximately 50-60% of each of the three course options is on gravel roads. This will add to both the challenge and unique nature of this event.

There are three ride length options of 100, 60 and 30 miles.

The courses all involve significant climbing in the form of short and sometimes steep hills. Often these hills come on the gravel road sections. Please bring adequately low gearing in consideration of this.

Course maps, cue sheets and full details will be provided at the event website, www.cirquesportive.com.
registration: Registration may be conducted online until May 8 at https://sport-vista.ngin.com/register/form/586859478
notes:
Equipment Reccomendations: A standard road bicycle with 700x25 or 28c tires is perfectly suitable for this event. A cyclocross bike also works well, but is not necessary. Mountain bikes are allowed, but will be a slower option. Due to climbing sections on gravel roads, a minimum 39x25 gear is recommended, and compact or triple cranksets are an even better option for those less proficient at climbing.

Triathlon/time trial bikes are not recommended for this event. Triathlon handlebars are not allowed (see below). Stout wheels and thicker/heavier tires are recommended. This is not a ride for carbon wheelsets or sub-200g tires.

Please make sure that your brakes/brake pads are in good working order, as there will be some technical sections and downhill turns.

Rules and Regulations: The Cirque Cyclosportive is a non-competitive ride, not a race. However, it will include a mass-start and is subject to some specific regulations under the permit granted by USA Cycling:

·	All participants must wear a helmet
·	Bicycles may not have motors or wind fairings attached
·	No trailers of any kind are allowed
·	No handlebar extensions (i.e. triathlon bars) are allowed
·	All handlebar ends must be appropriately covered or plugged
·	Tandems are allowed; however tandem riders will be grouped together at the start
directions: From VA Rt. 7 (East), take the Rt. 9 Exit (Hillsboro/Charles Town). At the end of the ramp, take a left onto Rt. 9. Cross over bridge and make the next left onto Dry Mill Rd.. Proceed 0.8 miles to 4-H Fairground entrance on left.

title: Peter Teeuwen Mem TT #1 Virginia AGE-grade
Carytown Bicycle Co. Bryan Park Circuit Race
description: Carytown Bicycle Co. presents the 7th annual Bryan Park Circuit Race
course: 1.8 mile enclosed course on park roads
registration: Registration closes at 6pm the day before the race.
directions:
From South or East of Richmond take 95 North to Exit 80 for Hermitage Rd.
Right at light onto Hermitage.  Take first left after the highway into Bryan Park.


From North of Richmond take 95 South to Exit 83B – Parham Road East
Turn Left onto Brook Rd – Rt 1
Turn Right onto Lakeside Ave
Turn Right into Bryan Park

In park stay left at first two turns and look for parking on the left.

Ride for Care - Fundraiser Ride
description:
RIDE FOR CULPEPER REGIONAL HOSPITAL
Co-hosted by Bull Run Hunt & Bike Stop Racing to benefit the CULPEPER REGIONAL HOSPITAL.

Date: SUNDAY, AUGUST 12, 2012
Time: 8:00-9:00am (start time)
Place: BULL RUN HUNT CLUBHOUSE
(12240 Mitchell Road, Mitchells, VA)

Event Director: Alex Forte (Bike Stop Racing)
The Bike Stop
bikestopteam@yahoo.com
www.bikestopteam.com
540-825-2105

Bull Run Hunt contact: Rosie Campbell
www.bullrunhunt.com
course: There will be three different ride options: 10 miles, 20 miles, and 30 miles with rest-stops/check-points at 5-10 mile increments.

(12240 Mitchell Road, Mitchells, VA)

title: Official Training Ride for the Alpine Loop Gran Fo
description: Prepare for Jeremiah Bishops Alpine Loop Gran Fondo presented by Prostate Cancer Awareness Project with this special one-day touring opportunity!
course: The route will begin in Harrisonburg, Virginia and bring riders into the mountains of Virginia and West Virginia where they will get to preview the most challenging climb of the Alpine Loop and Shenandoah Mountain Medio routes, respectively. The tour will be fully supported and feature a catered picnic lunch atop the day\'s highest summit.
registration:
The cost of the tour is $55/person. 
Register online at https://www.bikereg.com/Net/17038
notes: Participants will receive at least one e-mail leading up to the event with preparation tips and a list of equipment needs.
directions: Meeting place will be determined - downtown Harrisonburg, Virginia.

title: Jeremiah Bishop's ALPINE LOOP GRAN FONDO
description:
Saturday, September 15, 2012
Mountain climbs worthy of a grand tour, with the character and grit of a classic!

Jeremiah Bishop’s favorite training route earned its nickname with glorious mountain top meadows, winding climbs and hillside farms reminiscent of the Austrian, German and Swiss settings where he has competed.

Now this magnificent scenery is the backdrop for the most challenging and adventurous Gran Fondo in the United States. The route begins in Harrisonburg, Virginia and covers 95 miles featuring 11,000 feet of climbing.

The Alpine Loop Gran Fondo provides the opportunity and inspiration for individuals and teams to take on great challenges in support of worthy causes. All event proceeds will directly support community charities, local schools and cycling infrastructure.
course:
104-Mile Alpine Loop Gran Fondo
71-Mile Shenandoah Mountain Medio Route
32-Mile Valley View Piccolo Route

Route maps are available: http://www.AlpineLoopGranFondo.com/routes.html
notes:
Jeremiah Bishop\'s 2012 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo 
Presented by the Prostate Cancer Awareness Project
Saturday, September 15, 2012 - Harrisonburg, Virginia  

Hosted by professional cyclist Jeremiah Bishop, the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo is an event to welcome cyclists and spectators to his hometown of Harrisonburg, Virginia for an exciting weekend of special events, challenging rides, charity fundraising and festivities for the entire family. 

The event is electronic chip-timed, and participants can compete in the two KOM sections for the Prostate Cancer Awareness Project King and Queen of the Mountains Competition. (KOM Jerseys will be awarded to USAC 5-year age groups, U23 and older.)

For the latest and most complete information, visit www.AlpineLoopGranFondo.com
directions:
Event-day sign-in, staging and the Finish Line Festival will take place in Downtown Harrisonburg, Virginia in the park adjacent to the Turner Pavilion (location of Harrisonburg Farmer\'s Market). Google Maps - 240 Liberty Street Harrisonburg, Virginia 22801 does the trick.

Map to Harrisonburg, Virginia is available: http://www.AlpineLoopGranFondo.com/visitors.html

title: Turkey Run Cross by Fat Frogs
Miller School of Albemarle Cross
description: Cyclocross race hosted by the scenic Miller School of Albemarle, located in Charlottesville, Virginia at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Full day of racing complimented by live music.
course: Fun yet challenging, spectator-friendly course on Miller School of Albemarle\'s central campus. Mainly on grass with short stretch of pavement through start/finish area. Course features several off-camber turns, triple-barrier section, and run-up. Lap times of roughly 7 to 8 minutes for advanced competitors.
registration: Online registration offered through Bikereg. Day-of registration also available until 15 minutes before each start time.
notes: Kids race and Singlespeed race also offered.
directions:
Miller School of Albemarle
1000 Samuel Miller Loop
Charlottesville, VA 22903

One hour west of Richmond, VA; two hours south of Washington DC. Take exit 107 off Interstate 64 and turn onto US 250 East toward Crozet/Charlottesville. In 1.5 miles, take Right on Miller School Road. Go 3 miles, main entrance for Miller School of Albemarle will be on your left just after passing Dick Woods Road.

address.street: Richmond City Stadium,3201 Maplewood Ave, Richmond, VA 23221

title: Fountainhead Mountain Bike Time Trial
description: Each racer begins 5 minutes after the previous racers onto the scenic trails of Fountainhead Regional Park.  The winner will be determined by the fastest individual time on the course.
course: A technical course that will challenge beginners and expert mountain bikers!
registration: Go to http://bishopsevents.com/fountainhead_bike to find how to register for the mountain bike race!

title: TECH CROSS

address.street: Old Blacksburg HIgh School on Patrick Henry Drive

description: TECH CROSS!!  Virginia Tech\'s Home Cyclocross Race.
course: The course will be located at the Old Blacksburg Highschool on Patrick Henry Rd.  A mixture of pavement, singletrack, crazy run-ups, and a flat velodrome will be included.
registration: Collegiate Registration can be done online at ACCCycling.org.  The open categories will be non-USAC sanctioned and can be registered online at bike-reg or day of.
notes: It shall be gnar.  AND super fun for the whole family!
directions: From 81 south take exit 188b towards blacksburg.  Continue on 460 west passing Tom\'s Creek Rd and take a right on South Main St.  Patrick Henry drive will be at the first stoplight and take a left.  The highschool will be on the left and parking in the rear.
